New Records: Canada recorded their first win at a T20 World Cup
Canada beat a Test-playing nation at the T20 World Cup for the biggest win in their cricketing history
Key Match Events: Jeremy Gordon and Dillon Heyliger both took wickets as Ireland restricted to 125-7
Ireland lost two from two and look to be on the way out, especially after the US win over Pakistan
Post-Match Reflections: Nicholas Kirton: 'I tried to get the pace of the wicket. It wasn't so bad, bar the middle of the wicket, a pretty good wicket to bat on to be honest.'
Andrew Leonard: 'Ireland's lack of adaptability to different conditions, both with bat and ball, has cost them here.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada might be wondering if they can turn over Pakistan too.
This is the biggest win in Canada's cricketing history.
Ireland, so often the giant-killers, have been slayed.
What a tournament this is turning into.
Others: The match was played in New York.
Canada have outplayed Ireland in all three disciplines bat, ball and field.
